Title: Vice President of Technology
Headline: Brian McHale was Appointed as Vice President of Technology at Fisher Communications
What Happened: Seattle; WA-based Fisher Communications appointed Brian McHale as Vice President of Technology.
About Person: Mr. McHale was Chief Technology Officer; responsible for broadcast operations; information technology; and overall technology strategy for DIRECTV Sports Networks; LLC; consisting of regional sports networks in Seattle; Pittsburgh; Utah and Denver. Prior to joining DIRECTV Sports Networks; McHale was Vice President; Information Technology for Starz Entertainment; LLC; responsible for all aspects of IT planning; engineering; software development; database administration; service delivery; and support. McHale also spent more than 3 years at Discovery Communications as Vice President; Global Operations in Maryland and while in London he served as Vice President of IT international for Discovery in charge of all IT operations for the company outside of the United States. McHale also worked for MCI for 11 years; where he began his career as manager of software development and left as director of enterprise data and management services. As director; he was responsible for all aspects of MCI's global internal data network.
About Company: Fisher Communications; Inc. is a Seattle-based communications company that owns and operates 13 full power television stations; 7 low power television stations; and 8 radio stations in the western United States. The Company also owns and operates Fisher Interactive Network; its online division (including over 125 online sites); Fisher Pathways; a satellite and fiber transmission provider; and Fisher Plaza; a media; telecommunications; and data center facility located near downtown Seattle. For more information about Fisher Communications; Inc.; go to www.fsci.com.
